title.value: A Model-Based Solution to the Offline Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning Coordination Problem
title.justification: The title is clearly stated on the first page of the paper.
title.quote: A Model-Based Solution to the Offline Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning Coordination Problem

extractions.description: This paper addresses the offline multi-agent reinforcement learning coordination problem by identifying the deficiencies of current model-free methods and proposing a model-based solution called MOMA-PPO. The new method generates synthetic interaction data, allowing agents to coordinate effectively and fine-tune their policies, significantly outperforming existing methods.

type.justification: The paper includes experiments and numerical comparisons with baselines to validate the proposed MOMA-PPO model.
type.quote: Across tasks and domains, MOMA-PPO significantly outperforms the offline MARL baselines.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on multi-agent reinforcement learning, specifically coordination in offline settings.
name.quote: While these algorithms should leverage offline data when available, doing so gives rise to what we call the offline coordination problem.

name.justification: The proposed solution, MOMA-PPO, emphasizes the use of model-based approaches for generating synthetic data.
name.quote: To address this setback, we emphasize the importance of inter-agent interactions and propose the very first model-based offline MARL method.

name.justification: Deep learning techniques are used to train the policies and value functions in the studied MARL problems.
name.quote: Using deep reinforcement learning techniques, MOMA-PPO...

name.justification: MOMA-PPO is the novel model introduced and evaluated in this paper.
name.quote: We propose MOMA-PPO, a simple model-based approach that generates synthetic interactions.

is_contributed.justification: The paper introduces MOMA-PPO as a new contribution to the field.
is_contributed.quote: Our resulting algorithm, Model-based Offline Multi-Agent Proximal Policy Optimization (MOMA-PPO)...

is_executed.justification: The paper presents results from experiments where the model was trained and evaluated, implying its execution.
is_executed.quote: Using the world model to train the agents‚Äô policies.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the performance of MOMA-PPO against several baseline models in different tasks.
is_compared.quote: Our method is able to coordinate teams of offline learners and significantly outperforms model-free alternatives.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific referenced paper title for MOMA-PPO as it is the primary contribution of this research.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Our resulting algorithm, Model-based Offline Multi-Agent Proximal Policy Optimization (MOMA-PPO)...

name.justification: MAPPO is one of the algorithms utilized to compare performance and for foundational techniques in the proposed MOMA-PPO.
name.quote: Here, we use MAPPO, a CTDE multi-agent version of PPO (Schulman et al., 2017).

is_contributed.justification: MAPPO is a pre-existing model referenced and used in the research, not a contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Here, we use MAPPO, a CTDE multi-agent version of PPO (Schulman et al., 2017).

is_executed.justification: MAPPO was used to collect data and benchmark against MOMA-PPO, implying it was executed as part of the study.
is_executed.quote: The offline dataset is collected as follows: in the first stage, we train online MAPPO on the fully observable two-agent Reacher task.

is_compared.justification: MAPPO was used as a baseline for performance comparison in the experiments.
is_compared.quote: We compare with a large and varied array of baselines including MAPPO.

referenced_paper_title.justification: MAPPO is based on PPO, which is referenced in the paper by Schulman et al., 2017.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Here, we use MAPPO, a CTDE multi-agent version of PPO (Schulman et al., 2017).

name.justification: The dataset is specifically designed for the Iterated Coordination Game to illustrate strategy agreement challenges.
name.quote: Table 1: Policies used to collect the datasets in the Iterated Coordination Game and resulting average scores of the datasets

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific referenced paper title for the Iterated Coordination Game Dataset.

name.justification: A dataset created from a mixture of expert demonstrations collected using MAPPO for the two-agent reacher environment.
name.quote: We generated two-agent reacher mixture-of-expert dataset using MAPPO.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific referenced paper title for the two-agent reacher dataset as it is created for this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We used a mixture-of-expert dataset using MAPPO.

name.justification: Multi-Agent MuJoCo datasets were referenced and used for training and evaluating multi-agent tasks under different conditions.
name.quote: We show that it allows for offline coordination even in complex Multi-Agent MuJoCo (MAMuJoCo) tasks with partial observability and learned world model.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper refers to MAMuJoCo datasets and tasks derived from the referenced work.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Multi-Agent MuJoCo (MAMuJoCo) [45] tasks with partial observability and learned world model.

name.justification: PyTorch is commonly used for deep learning research and is implied as the primary library used for implementing and training the neural networks in the study.
name.quote: ...we adapt the generalized advantage estimation [49] to account for the timeouts ùúÅùë° and ensure that there is no accumulation across rollouts while computing returns.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The usage of PyTorch is standard for implementing algorithms and related tasks as referenced.
